atmpMIBVersionMajor.name: atmpMIBVersionMajor
atmpMIBVersionMajor.description: Major version number for the GRF ATMP MIB. This number is incremented when structural changes occur to the GRF ATMP MIB.

atmpMIBVersionMinor.name: atmpMIBVersionMinor
atmpMIBVersionMinor.description: Minor version number for the GRF ATMP MIB. This number is incremented when non-structural changes occur to the GRF ATMP MIB

atmpUDPPort.name: atmpUDPPort
atmpUDPPort.description: UDP port number to be used for ATMP.

atmpEnableAtmpTraps.name: atmpEnableAtmpTraps
atmpEnableAtmpTraps.description: Enable the atmp traps. There are no traps in the GRF ATMP implementation, so this is always disabled but left as a placeholder for future feature enhancement.

atmpNumberFAs.name: atmpNumberFAs
atmpNumberFAs.description: The number of foreign agents in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpNumberHNs.name: atmpNumberHNs
atmpNumberHNs.description: The number of home networks in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpMaxNumberHNs.name: atmpMaxNumberHNs
atmpMaxNumberHNs.description: The maximum number of home networks allowed in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpDFAConfigured.name: atmpDFAConfigured
atmpDFAConfigured.description: Specifies whether a default foreign agent is configured in the GRF ATMP configuration. The default foreign agent record specifies multiple foreign agents with a single IP wildcard address. This is an optional record. A default foreign agent type of record can be used in addition to a regular foreign agent record to establish tunnels to the same home network.

atmpDFAWildcardIpAddress.name: atmpDFAWildcardIpAddress
atmpDFAWildcardIpAddress.description: The default foreign agent requires an IP wildcard address, 192.15.*.*, for example. If a wildcard IP address is not specified, the default value of *.*.*.* is used. The address need not be wildcarded and can be filled out completely.

atmpDFAPassword.name: atmpDFAPassword
atmpDFAPassword.description: The password that validates the default foreign agent to the GRF home agent. It is also configured in the mobile node's RADIUS profile as the Ascend-Home-Agent-Password. If a password is not specified, a tunnel is not negotiated. Reading this object always results in a DisplayString of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

atmpNumberTunnelsUp.name: atmpNumberTunnelsUp
atmpNumberTunnelsUp.description: The number of tunnels currently in the up state.

atmpNumberTunnelsRegistering.name: atmpNumberTunnelsRegistering
atmpNumberTunnelsRegistering.description: The number of tunnels currently in the registering state.

atmpNumberFAFailingMatch.name: atmpNumberFAFailingMatch
atmpNumberFAFailingMatch.description: The number of foreign agents that failed to match any of the foreign agent records in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpNumberFAPasswordRejects.name: atmpNumberFAPasswordRejects
atmpNumberFAPasswordRejects.description: The number of foreign agents whose tunnel request failed to match the password of the identified foreign agent record in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpNumberDFAMatch.name: atmpNumberDFAMatch
atmpNumberDFAMatch.description: The number of foreign agents whose IP address did not match that of any specific foreign agent in the GRF ATMP configuration, but matched the wildcard address of the default foreign agent record.

atmpRxRegistrationRequestPkts.name: atmpRxRegistrationRequestPkts
atmpRxRegistrationRequestPkts.description: The number of ATMP registration request packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxChallengeReplyPkts.name: atmpRxChallengeReplyPkts
atmpRxChallengeReplyPkts.description: The number of ATMP challenge reply packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxDeRegistrationRequestPkts.name: atmpRxDeRegistrationRequestPkts
atmpRxDeRegistrationRequestPkts.description: The number of ATMP deregistration request packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxChallengeRequestPkts.name: atmpTxChallengeRequestPkts
atmpTxChallengeRequestPkts.description: The number of ATMP challenge request packets sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxRegistrationReplyPkts.name: atmpTxRegistrationReplyPkts
atmpTxRegistrationReplyPkts.description: The number of ATMP registration reply packets sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxDeRegistrationReplyPkts.name: atmpTxDeRegistrationReplyPkts
atmpTxDeRegistrationReplyPkts.description: The number of ATMP deregistration reply packets sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxErrorNotificationPkts.name: atmpRxErrorNotificationPkts
atmpRxErrorNotificationPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxNoErrorPkts.name: atmpRxNoErrorPkts
atmpRxNoErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NO_ERROR error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxAuthFailedPkts.name: atmpRxAuthFailedPkts
atmpRxAuthFailedPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the AUTH_FAILED error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxNotEnabledPkts.name: atmpRxNotEnabledPkts
atmpRxNotEnabledPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NOT_ENABLED error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxTooManyPkts.name: atmpRxTooManyPkts
atmpRxTooManyPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the TOO_MANY error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxParameterErrorPkts.name: atmpRxParameterErrorPkts
atmpRxParameterErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the PARAMETER_ERROR error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxInvalidTunnelIdPkts.name: atmpRxInvalidTunnelIdPkts
atmpRxInvalidTunnelIdPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the INVALID_TUNNEL_ID error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxTimeoutPkts.name: atmpRxTimeoutPkts
atmpRxTimeoutPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the TIMEOUT error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxNetUnreachablePkts.name: atmpRxNetUnreachablePkts
atmpRxNetUnreachablePkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NET_UNREACHABLE error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxGeneralErrorPkts.name: atmpRxGeneralErrorPkts
atmpRxGeneralErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the GENERAL_ERROR error code received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxChallengeRequestPkts.name: atmpRxChallengeRequestPkts
atmpRxChallengeRequestPkts.description: The number of ATMP challenge request packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF. These should not be received by a home agent, and are dropped.

atmpRxRegistrationReplyPkts.name: atmpRxRegistrationReplyPkts
atmpRxRegistrationReplyPkts.description: The number of ATMP registration reply packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF. These should not be received by a home agent, and are dropped.

atmpRxDeRegistrationReplyPkts.name: atmpRxDeRegistrationReplyPkts
atmpRxDeRegistrationReplyPkts.description: The number of ATMP deregistration reply packets received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF. These should not be received by a home agent, and are dropped.

atmpRxUndersizeLengthPkts.name: atmpRxUndersizeLengthPkts
atmpRxUndersizeLengthPkts.description: The number of ATMP packets less than the minimum packet length received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxBadVersionPkts.name: atmpRxBadVersionPkts
atmpRxBadVersionPkts.description: The number of ATMP packets containing a bad ATMP version number received by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxBufferAllocFailPkts.name: atmpRxBufferAllocFailPkts
atmpRxBufferAllocFailPkts.description: The number of received ATMP packets dropped due to buffer allocation failure by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxBadAtmpCodePkts.name: atmpRxBadAtmpCodePkts
atmpRxBadAtmpCodePkts.description: The number of ATMP packets dropped due to receiving an invalid type of ATMP packet in the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpRxNetworkErrors.name: atmpRxNetworkErrors
atmpRxNetworkErrors.description: The number of occurrences of a network error while attempting to receive ATMP packets by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxErrorNotificationPkts.name: atmpTxErrorNotificationPkts
atmpTxErrorNotificationPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxNoErrorPkts.name: atmpTxNoErrorPkts
atmpTxNoErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NO_ERROR error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxAuthFailedPkts.name: atmpTxAuthFailedPkts
atmpTxAuthFailedPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the AUTH_FAILED error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxNotEnabledPkts.name: atmpTxNotEnabledPkts
atmpTxNotEnabledPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NOT_ENABLED error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxTooManyPkts.name: atmpTxTooManyPkts
atmpTxTooManyPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the TOO_MANY error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxParameterErrorPkts.name: atmpTxParameterErrorPkts
atmpTxParameterErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the PARAMETER_ERROR error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxInvalidTunnelIdPkts.name: atmpTxInvalidTunnelIdPkts
atmpTxInvalidTunnelIdPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the INVALID_TUNNEL_ID error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxTimeoutPkts.name: atmpTxTimeoutPkts
atmpTxTimeoutPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the TIMEOUT error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxNetUnreachablePkts.name: atmpTxNetUnreachablePkts
atmpTxNetUnreachablePkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the NET_UNREACHABLE error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxGeneralErrorPkts.name: atmpTxGeneralErrorPkts
atmpTxGeneralErrorPkts.description: The number of ATMP error notification packets containing the GENERAL_ERROR error code sent by the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpTxNetworkErrors.name: atmpTxNetworkErrors
atmpTxNetworkErrors.description: The number of occurrences of a network error while attempting to send ATMP packets from the ATMP daemon process on the GRF.

atmpFATable.name: atmpFATable
atmpFATable.description: The Foreign Agent Table. A list of foreign agent records in the GRF ATMP configuration. This table reflects the foreign agent records found in the configuration file of the ATMP daemon on the GRF. The table is indexed by the foreign agent IP address (atmpFAIpAddress), and is ordered by the 32-bit numerical representation of the foreign agent IP address, lowest to highest.

atmpFAEntry.name: atmpFAEntry
atmpFAEntry.description: An ATMP foreign agent record in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpFAIpAddress.name: atmpFAIpAddress
atmpFAIpAddress.description: The IP address assigned to the foreign agent. The home agent uses this as the destination address in the GRE header.

atmpFAPassword.name: atmpFAPassword
atmpFAPassword.description: The password that validates the foreign agent to the GRF home agent. It is also configured in the mobile node's RADIUS profile as the Ascend-Home-Agent-Password. If a password is not specified, tunnels cannot be negotiated. Reading this object always results in a DisplayString of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

atmpFANumberTunnels.name: atmpFANumberTunnels
atmpFANumberTunnels.description: The number of tunnels associated with this foreign agent.

atmpHNTable.name: atmpHNTable
atmpHNTable.description: Home Network Table. A list of home network records in the GRF ATMP configuration. This table reflects the home network records found in the configuration file of the ATMP daemon on the GRF. Some per home network tunnel statistics are kept in this table. The table is indexed by the home agent IP address (atmpHAIpAddress), and is ordered by the 32-bit numerical representation of the home agent IP address, lowest to highest.

atmpHNEntry.name: atmpHNEntry
atmpHNEntry.description: An ATMP home network record in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpHAIpAddress.name: atmpHAIpAddress
atmpHAIpAddress.description: The home agent address. Each home network maps to a different local IP address on the GRF. The foreign agent uses the address as the destination address in its IP encapsulation header. The GRF home agent uses it as the source address in its IP encapsulation header.

atmpHNName.name: atmpHNName
atmpHNName.description: The unique name expressed as a text string of up to 31 characters that is used by the foreign agent to identify the home network.

atmpHNMTULimit.name: atmpHNMTULimit
atmpHNMTULimit.description: Controls whether and how pre-fragmentation occurs. If the value is 0 (the default), no pre-fragmentation is performed (post- fragmentation is performed). If nonzero, mtu_limit specifies the maximum size of the fragments, prior to encapsulation, before pre-fragmentation will occur. If the value is -1 (auto), the mtu_limit is automatically computed for each packet so as to avoid post-fragmentation. If the mtu_limit parameter is not present in the home network record, it is set to the default (0).

atmpHNForceFragmentation.name: atmpHNForceFragmentation
atmpHNForceFragmentation.description: Controls the behavior of the GRF home agent when it receives a packet from the home network that requires pre-fragmentation, but has the IP DF (Don't Fragment) option set. It is ignored when mtu_limit is zero. If the force_fragmentation parameter is not present in the home network record, it is set to no as the default.

atmpHNBadSourceNotification.name: atmpHNBadSourceNotification
atmpHNBadSourceNotification.description: Controls whether a foreign agent is notified when packets from a mobile node have a bad source address. If the bad_source_notification parameter is not present in the home network record, the value defaults to yes.

atmpHNMaxTunnels.name: atmpHNMaxTunnels
atmpHNMaxTunnels.description: The maximum number of tunnels allowed for the home network. The maximum tunnel value does not guarantee the number of usable tunnels per home network. It is up to the local administrator to determine an appropriate value based on the predicted usage of each mobile node and the available bandwidth on the home agent to home network link. The default 0 (zero) is to set no limit. If the max_tunnels parameter is not present in the home network record, the default value of zero is used.

atmpHNInactivityTimeout.name: atmpHNInactivityTimeout
atmpHNInactivityTimeout.description: The number of hours a home network's tunnels can be inactive before removal. The default is 0 (zero) hours if no timer parameter is added. A value of zero disables the inactivity timeout feature for the home network. If the inactivity_timeout parameter is not present in the home network record, the default value of zero is used.

atmpHNNumberTunnels.name: atmpHNNumberTunnels
atmpHNNumberTunnels.description: The number of tunnels associated with this home network.

atmpHNInactiveTunnelsRemoved.name: atmpHNInactiveTunnelsRemoved
atmpHNInactiveTunnelsRemoved.description: The number of tunnels associated with this home network that were removed because of inactivity.

atmpHNTunnelsMaxRejected.name: atmpHNTunnelsMaxRejected
atmpHNTunnelsMaxRejected.description: The number of tunnels associated with this home network that were rejected because the maximum number of tunnels for the home network was exceeded.

atmpHNTunnelHighWater.name: atmpHNTunnelHighWater
atmpHNTunnelHighWater.description: The largest number of concurrently active tunnels associated with the home network.

atmpHNSwitchToStandbyInterface.name: atmpHNSwitchToStandbyInterface
atmpHNSwitchToStandbyInterface.description: The number of times the Home Agent had to switch to the standby interface when the primary interface went down.

atmpHNSwitchToPrimaryInterface.name: atmpHNSwitchToPrimaryInterface
atmpHNSwitchToPrimaryInterface.description: The number of times the Home Agent switched back to the primary interface when the primary interface went up again.

atmpHNRxErrorCount.name: atmpHNRxErrorCount
atmpHNRxErrorCount.description: The total number of errors received by this HN. The last 10 of these appear in atmpHNRxErrorTable.

atmpHNTxErrorCount.name: atmpHNTxErrorCount
atmpHNTxErrorCount.description: The total number of errors transmitted by this HN. The last 10 of these appear in atmpHNTxErrorTable.

atmpHNInterfaceCount.name: atmpHNInterfaceCount
atmpHNInterfaceCount.description: The number of interfaces (or circuits) configured for this HN.

atmpHNTxErrorTable.name: atmpHNTxErrorTable
atmpHNTxErrorTable.description: Home Network Transmit Error Table. A list of the most recent errors transmitted from a home network interface. The error code, foreign agent IP address, and the timestamp of the transmitted error are tracked in this table. A maximum of 10 errors are stored in this table. The table is indexed by the home agent IP address (atmpHAIpAddress) and an error index (atmpHNTxErrorIndex). The table is ordered first by the 32-bit numerical representation of the home agent IP address, lowest to highest, and then by the error index, lowest to highest. The error index represents the order of occurrence, where the lower the index the more recent the occurrence.

atmpHNTxErrorEntry.name: atmpHNTxErrorEntry
atmpHNTxErrorEntry.description: A transmitted error entry of the Home Network Transmit Error Table.

atmpHNTxErrorIndex.name: atmpHNTxErrorIndex
atmpHNTxErrorIndex.description: This is the secondary index for the Home Network Transmit Error Table. Indices start at zero and represent the most recent to least recent errors that occurred.

atmpHNTxErrorCode.name: atmpHNTxErrorCode
atmpHNTxErrorCode.description: The error code sent to a foreign agent by the GRF ATMP daemon process for a home network. The error code is the value of the result code from RFC 2107 plus 1.

atmpHNTxErrorFAIpAddress.name: atmpHNTxErrorFAIpAddress
atmpHNTxErrorFAIpAddress.description: The IP address of the foreign agent that the GRF ATMP daemon process sent atmpHNTxErrorCode to. If the error is associated with an existing tunnel, the foreign agent IP address comes from foreign agent record of the aitmd.conf configuration file. Otherwise, the foreign agent IP address is the IP address associated with the network socket created to send to the foreign agent (e.g. failed tunnel negotiation due to unknown foreign agent IP address).

atmpHNTxErrorTime.name: atmpHNTxErrorTime
atmpHNTxErrorTime.description: The time atmpHNTxErrorCode was sent to the foreign agent.

atmpHNRxErrorTable.name: atmpHNRxErrorTable
atmpHNRxErrorTable.description: Home Network Receive Error Table. A list of the most recent errors received on a home network interface. The error code, foreign agent IP address, and the timestamp of the received error are tracked in this table. A maximum of 10 errors are stored in this table. The table is indexed by the home agent IP address (atmpHAIpAddress) and an error index (atmpHNRxErrorIndex). The table is ordered first by the 32-bit numerical representation of the home agent IP address, lowest to highest, and then by the error index, lowest to highest. The error index represents the order of occurrence, where the lower the index the more recent the occurrence.

atmpHNRxErrorEntry.name: atmpHNRxErrorEntry
atmpHNRxErrorEntry.description: A received error entry of the Home Network Transmit Error Table.

atmpHNRxErrorIndex.name: atmpHNRxErrorIndex
atmpHNRxErrorIndex.description: This is the secondary index for the Home Network Receive Error Table. Indices start at zero and represent the most recent to least recent errors that occurred.

atmpHNRxErrorCode.name: atmpHNRxErrorCode
atmpHNRxErrorCode.description: The error code received from a foreign agent by the GRF ATMP daemon process for a home network. The error code is the value of the result code from RFC 2107 plus 1.

atmpHNRxErrorFAIpAddress.name: atmpHNRxErrorFAIpAddress
atmpHNRxErrorFAIpAddress.description: The IP address of the foreign agent that the GRF ATMP daemon process received atmpHNRxErrorCode from.

atmpHNRxErrorTime.name: atmpHNRxErrorTime
atmpHNRxErrorTime.description: The time atmpHNRxErrorCode was received from the foreign agent.

atmpHNInterfaceTable.name: atmpHNInterfaceTable
atmpHNInterfaceTable.description: Home Network Interface Table. A list of interface/circuit records in a home network record of the GRF ATMP configuration. This table defines the interface/circuit records for the home network entries found in the Home Network Table. There must be 1 or 2 entries in the configuration. Each entry has values from the configuration file and system runtime parameters of the configuration items. This table is indexed by the Home Network Table index (atmpHAIpAddress), and the home network interface priority (atmpHNInterfacePriority). The table is ordered first by the 32-bit numerical representation of the home agent IP address, lowest to highest, and then by the interface priority, lowest to highest.

atmpHNInterfaceEntry.name: atmpHNInterfaceEntry
atmpHNInterfaceEntry.description: An ATMP interface record of a home network record in the GRF ATMP configuration.

atmpHNInterfacePriority.name: atmpHNInterfacePriority
atmpHNInterfacePriority.description: This is the secondary index for atmpHNInterfaceTable. A combination of the home agent IP address and this index uniquely identify the home network interface entry (atmpHNInterfaceEntry).

atmpHNInterfaceName.name: atmpHNInterfaceName
atmpHNInterfaceName.description: Interface name in standard GRF gx0yz format that indicates media, slot, and logical interface number (interface{name}).

atmpHNInterfaceConfigType.name: atmpHNInterfaceConfigType
atmpHNInterfaceConfigType.description: The type of configuration record the interface is defined with in the GRF ATMP configuration file.

atmpHNInterfaceCard.name: atmpHNInterfaceCard
atmpHNInterfaceCard.description: The slot number for a HSSI or ATM card. For interface records, this is determined using the interface name (circuit{card}).

atmpHNInterfacePort.name: atmpHNInterfacePort
atmpHNInterfacePort.description: The port number (or link) for the HSSI or ATM circuit. For interface records, this is determined using the interface name (circuit{port}).

atmpHNInterfaceDcliOrVpi.name: atmpHNInterfaceDcliOrVpi
atmpHNInterfaceDcliOrVpi.description: The DLCI for a HSSI link, or the VPI value for an ATMP PVC. For interface records, this is determined using the interface name (circuit{s0}).

atmpHNInterfaceVci.name: atmpHNInterfaceVci
atmpHNInterfaceVci.description: The VCI value for an ATM PVC, or 0 (zero) if a HSSI card. For interface records, this is determined using the interface name (circuit{s1}).

atmpHNInterfaceVpnAddress.name: atmpHNInterfaceVpnAddress
atmpHNInterfaceVpnAddress.description: The customer-assigned virtual private network address for the home agent on the home network, must be in the private network address space. If the vpn_addr parameter is not present in the interface (or circuit) record, the default value is 255.255.255.255 (interface{vpn_addr}).

atmpHNInterfaceVpnNetmaskSize.name: atmpHNInterfaceVpnNetmaskSize
atmpHNInterfaceVpnNetmaskSize.description: Number of bits in the netmask for the virtual private network address. If the vpn_netmask_size parameter is not present in the interface (or circuit) record, the default value is 0 (zero) (interface{vpn_netmask_size}).

atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Enabled.name: atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Enabled
atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Enabled.description: Sets aitmd to send RIPv2 packets across the circuits to connected home networks. The packets carry the routes of all mobile nodes assigned to this home agent. The routes connect the home agent virtual private network address with the mobile node's private address. If the ripv2 record is not present, this defaults to not enabled (ripv2{enabled}).

atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Metric.name: atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Metric
atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Metric.description: Specifies the metric advertised with each route, where the metric is ignored if enabled is specified as no. If the ripv2 record is not present, this defaults to zero (ripv2{metric}).

atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Pkts.name: atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Pkts
atmpHNInterfaceRipv2Pkts.description: The number of ripv2 packets sent by the GRF home agent on this interface.

atmpHNInterfaceCompleteness.name: atmpHNInterfaceCompleteness
atmpHNInterfaceCompleteness.description: The completeness status of the interface. A value other than complete (1) is considered an error status.

atmpTunnelTable.name: atmpTunnelTable
atmpTunnelTable.description: The Tunnel Table. A list of ATMP tunnel entries. This table is indexed by the Home Network Table index (atmpHAIpAddress), and by the tunnel's mobile node address (atmpTunnelMNIpAddress). The table is ordered by the 32-bit numerical representation of the home agent IP address, lowest to highest, and then by the 32-bit numerical representation of the tunnel's mobile node IP address, lowest to highest.

atmpTunnelId.name: atmpTunnelId
atmpTunnelId.description: The identification assigned to this tunnel. This number is assigned by the HA. NOTE: this number does *not* uniquely identify a tunnel by itself. This is only unique per home network/agent.

atmpTunnelState.name: atmpTunnelState
atmpTunnelState.description: The states the tunnel can be in.

atmpTunnelProtocol.name: atmpTunnelProtocol
atmpTunnelProtocol.description: This value indicates the protocol(s) that the tunnel supports. The value is a sum. The sum initially takes the value zero. Then for each protocol that is supported, the value of the protocol is or'ed to the sum. Example: 3 means ip and ipx.

atmpTunnelFAIpAddress.name: atmpTunnelFAIpAddress
atmpTunnelFAIpAddress.description: The IP address assigned to the foreign agent associated with this tunnel. This can be used as the index into the Foreign Agent Table.

atmpTunnelMnIpAddress.name: atmpTunnelMnIpAddress
atmpTunnelMnIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the Mobile Node.

atmpTunnelMnNetmask.name: atmpTunnelMnNetmask
atmpTunnelMnNetmask.description: The netmask of the Mobile Node.

atmpTunnelMnIpxNetAddress.name: atmpTunnelMnIpxNetAddress
atmpTunnelMnIpxNetAddress.description: The IPX network address of the Mobile Node.

atmpTunnelMnIpxNodeAddress.name: atmpTunnelMnIpxNodeAddress
atmpTunnelMnIpxNodeAddress.description: The IPX node address of the Mobile Node.

atmpTunnelActive.name: atmpTunnelActive
atmpTunnelActive.description: The active/inactive status of the tunnel.

atmpTunnelInPkts.name: atmpTunnelInPkts
atmpTunnelInPkts.description: The number of packets received on this tunnel from the foreign agent. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelInOctets.name: atmpTunnelInOctets
atmpTunnelInOctets.description: The number of octets received on this tunnel from the foreign agent. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelInErrPkts.name: atmpTunnelInErrPkts
atmpTunnelInErrPkts.description: The number of packets received on this tunnel from the foreign agent that were dropped. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelOutPkts.name: atmpTunnelOutPkts
atmpTunnelOutPkts.description: The number of packets sent on this tunnel to the foreign agent. This is not supported at this time and wile contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelOutOctets.name: atmpTunnelOutOctets
atmpTunnelOutOctets.description: The number of octets sent on this tunnel to the foreign agent. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelOutErrPkts.name: atmpTunnelOutErrPkts
atmpTunnelOutErrPkts.description: The number of packets dropped on this tunnel before sending to the foreign agent. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelInOctetRate.name: atmpTunnelInOctetRate
atmpTunnelInOctetRate.description: The number of octets per second received on this tunnel from the peer agent. atmpTunnelInOctets and atmpTunnelInOctetSampleRate affect this value. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelInOctetSampleRate.name: atmpTunnelInOctetSampleRate
atmpTunnelInOctetSampleRate.description: The number of seconds between samples of atmpTunnelInOctets. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelOutOctetRate.name: atmpTunnelOutOctetRate
atmpTunnelOutOctetRate.description: The number of octets per second sent on this tunnel to the peer agent. atmpTunnelOutOctets and atmpTunnelOutOctetSampleRate affect this value. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelOutOctetSampleRate.name: atmpTunnelOutOctetSampleRate
atmpTunnelOutOctetSampleRate.description: The number of seconds between samples of atmpTunnelOutOctets. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelForcedToFragmentPkts.name: atmpTunnelForcedToFragmentPkts
atmpTunnelForcedToFragmentPkts.description: The number of packets forced to pre-fragment despite the DF bit. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.

atmpTunnelFailedToFragmentPkts.name: atmpTunnelFailedToFragmentPkts
atmpTunnelFailedToFragmentPkts.description: The number of packets required to be fragmented but were dropped because force fragmentation was disabled and the DF bit in the IP header was set. This is not supported at this time and will contain a value of zero.
